name: Design Hotel Mr. President

reviews.title: stay here
reviews.text: Arrived 10pm at nearby Belgrade railway station after 10 hour journey,5mins. walk to hotel straight to room wash then bar excellent staff and room.excellent breakfast ,good room enjoyed the boutique designs around the place .Reception helped us out with directions .Handy for trains,buses and excellent trams we would stay here next visit to Serbia.No problems with this hotel!

reviews.title: Don't leave home without your earplugs!
reviews.text: I stayed in this Hotel in September 2011. The first shock was the loud techno muic playing in the reception area. Now I am in my 50s so this could just be me being older and not expecting this. The receptionist was very "come day go day" and not really interested in the fact that the first room we were offered was on the first floor above a cafe and the music was very loud even with the windows closed. We were eventually upgraded to a suite also on the first floor, as this was the only room available. This room was extremely dark with low level lighting and no chance of getting any increase in lighting. The safe was not attached to anything and could be lifted and taken out of the room with no effort. The hotel is on the junction of 3 very busy roads, opposite the bus station and has the local tram system going both ways. There is a huge amount of constant traffic rumbling past and the double glazing system does not work so you can only plug your ears to block out the sound. Unfortunately, I had left mine at home but I did have some cotton wool and this provided some relief. Things are not helped by the Traffic Police who turn up about 07:00 and start blowing their whistles in the middle of the traffic in an effort to maintain some sanity. The buffet meals are adequate and the staff in the dining room are plesant. There is free wi-fi but it very slow and I think the free intermational calls are so can ring home and ask someone to get you out of there!

reviews.title: Avoid. Tricked me into pre-paying for a room, then moved me to an an inferior hotel out of town.
reviews.text: Disgusting treatment at this hotel. As a female solo traveller I would expect that having pre-paid for my room I would be guaranteed a room on arrival. Silly me. On arrival the receptionist casually informed me that the hotel was full and that they were sending me by taxi to their "nearby" sister hotel. The taxi was at my expense and was actually a 25 minute journey - right out of town. I had picked the hotel for its central location. This sister hotel was miles away, bleak, gloomy, empty, dark and smoky. All in all a miserable, unsettling experience. I would advise anyone to think long and hard before ever booking with the Design Hotel chain.Unless you like unpleasant surprises.

reviews.title: Interesting hotel in interesting city
reviews.text: Went to Belgrad for a weekend with my friend (both 30´s). Booked this hotel through their website and paid 95Euros for room and halfboard.

reviews.title: Serious bed bug issue!
reviews.text: Service: The service is really very good. We were planning to go in May, but our flights got cancelled. We prepaid already, but the hotel was so kind to offer us an additional weekend in 2011. In October we arrived with a 5 hour delay (planes) and our arranged pick up got mixed up. But the hotel took care of everything in a smooth way.

If you are travlling by train this is the perfect place, right near the station. The value for money in Belgrade overall is great and this hotel is a fine example of that. We had great food for both breakfast and dinner (included) and found the whole kitch design concept really fun. We stayed in the bill Clinton room which was very nice including a very kitsch picture of Bill. A great place to stay for a quick look at Belgrade
reviews.title: Great fun and great value

reviews.text: Stayed in Design Mr President for 4 nights from 27/04 to 30/04. We travelled as a group of 6 males, with 3 sharing a triple room and the other 3 singles. Rooms were huge and comfortable. The Service was excellent with all staff happy to help with our queries and good food in the restaurant for breakfast and dinner (fully included in our package). The hotel is only 200m from the Train Station with the only downside being about a 15-20 minute walk to get to the town centre which is a bit arduous in parts as is generally uphill. Doesn't mean the hotel feels 'out of the way' though and is brilliantly located for Belgrades many bars and nightclubs (8 minute walk to the Port Side which seems to be the place for the trendiest Serbs to hang out). Overall delighted with our stay at the hotel and are literally planning our trip back already!
reviews.title: Superb Hotel at very reasonable price

reviews.text: It was my first time in Belgrade. I stayed in Design Mr President for buisness 9-13 April. Having stayed in over 200 hotels while on buisness over the last 10 years I never came across such a gem as Mr. President. This place rocks and is..well.......not boring like most hotels! I was bit shocked when I arrived because the hotel does not look very "Design" from the outside. Once you enter you know you are in a stylish place - sculptures and all else. I was first given the room on the first floor (cannot remember President's name over the bed but he was not Jelzin!) overlooking the backyard and somewhat noisy, so asked to be relocated. Staff at the reception was professional beyond any world standards. They very promptly relocated me to the 6th floor (with President Roosevelt, I think it was room 601). Massive apartment, not the room in fact. Amazingly comfortable bed, bathroom very large and cleaner than you can imagine. Bathrobe, slippers (in pink and white for her and him!), coffee, tea, minibar, free international calls (not within Serbia though, not sure why?), free internet and buffet breakfast and supper. I do agree with someone commenting here that free supper is the same every night which for business traveller staying there for a week is bit repetitive. After walking up the hill last Sunday in a heat (not snow, not sure which is worse!) I worked out the quickest way to the Old Town is tram number 2 which stops just outside the hotel and takes you to Kalemegdan Park. Taxi is a bad choice due to heavy traffic and for non-smokers a very bad experience.
reviews.title: This hotel is the most original I ever stayed, I LOVED IT!

reviews.text: I agree totally that the staff is super super super super professional (and waiters are soooooooooooooooooooooo handsome!)
reviews.title: Outstanding Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the Hotel Mr. President for four days in January and can comfortably recommend this hotel to business or leisure travelers. It is within walking distance of the old city. The rooms are clean and service is outstanding and prompt. The front desk is pleasant and responsive. All rooms are smoke free and a good breakfast is included in the rate. Also, ALL calls (international or otherwise) are FREE to any land line in the world! I will absolutely stay at The Mr. President when I return to Belgrade.
reviews.title: Exotic, extraordinary, and excellent..!!!
Great location & good value
reviews.text: Good location - right by the main Railway station and a few minutes walk from the main touristic attraction and the city center.

reviews.title: Good, Funky, Chic, Wonderful
reviews.text: Service is good, we have been by mistake put in a standard room while we had booked a superior room and we've been upgraded right away to the best available room.

reviews.title: Good location, price, service & clean = Good choice
reviews.text: Breakfast AND breakfast are included in the room price but don't expect great food, it's just OK. A good thing is that breakfast is served until 11:30, ideal when you enjoyed Belgrade's nightlife!

reviews.title: Good hotel but not as innovative as I thought
reviews.text: The decoration is original and free Wi-Fi is available everywhere in the hotel.

reviews.title: Excelent Hotel
reviews.text: This is a hotel with good value for money and for Serbia, a few things should be improved to make of this hotel a top-class hotel.
Excellent choice! The playful design gives it a cozy and unique charme. Location and service are superb. You can have breakfast until noon and it's surprisingly inexpensive.
reviews.title: Great hotel!

reviews.text: My only complaints: The room, even though it was really clean, had a strange and somewhat unpleasant smell to it. And I was missing a fitness room.
reviews.title: Decent hotel with good service

reviews.text: I chosed this hotel because of it's location was good to have a walk around, and yes it is, but maybe I could have chosen an other area and still would have gotten the same possibilities to explore the city by foot. Anyway, it's a nice hotel, the staff were polite and helpful. Breakfast was good, but nothing special. In my package I also had a free dinner, which I never used because I was out all day and night. The rooms were nice and comfortable, though a bit nosy because of the traffic outside. In the bathroom the soap bottle was empty, and not refilled during my two days. It's a very good hotel, but the price is also higher. One negative thing was that when I checked out, someone else had put a bill from the restaurant on my room, but when I explained it wasn't mine and I asked them to compare the signature on the receipt with the one in my passport, it was all ok, but I think they should have better control of putting bills on the rooms. I think I will chose another hotel next one, it was nice but nothing extra for me chosing this one.
reviews.title: Decent Place

reviews.text: Mr President is a decent option in Belgrade if you are prepared to pay just a little bit extra than some of the places nearby. The dinner was excellent and included in the price, at least it was at the time I stayed there.
reviews.title: great in every respect

reviews.text: The rooms are very clean but sparsely furnished, still they do just fine.
reviews.title: Terrible service. Does not live up to expectations.

description: You can enjoy presidential treatment at the Design Hotel Mr. President, which is situated in the heart of the city offering free airport transfer, free wireless internet access and worldwide free phone calls. There are business rooms, suites and a penthouse for you to choose from. Each of the luxurious rooms features a portrait of a world-famous president. The best Serbian artists created 2 small-scale versions - one American and one Serbian - of Mount Rushmore for the Rushmore bar. The entire hotel is decorated with selected artwork including steel and ceramic sculptures and paintings. Hotel Rooms: 61
